Material used.Description: Fibroblasts from a patient with PINK1 mutation were grown in low glucose DMEM.

Readout description.Result Description: Significant depression of oligomycin-sensitive respiratory activity, approximately 50% reduction in CCCP-uncoupled state compared to controls.
Coexists with PINK1 mutation, potentially contributing to increased ROS production due to altered kinetics of complex I.
Coexists with PINK1 mutation, potentially contributing to increased ROS production due to altered kinetics of complex I.

Biological replicates.Description: The values shown are mean ± SEM of 5-7 assays with different cell preparations.

Basic positive control.Description: Control human fibroblasts (NHDF) were used as a positive control for comparison.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test was applied, with a P < 0.05, to evaluate the statistical significance of differences.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Respiratory control ratio and oxygen consumption rates comparable to control fibroblasts (NHDF).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in respiratory activity (approximately 50% reduction in CCCP-uncoupled state) compared to control fibroblasts.

Material used.Description: Fibroblasts from a patient with PINK1 mutation were cultured at low density on fibronectin-coated dishes.

Readout description.Result Description: Significant accumulation of H2O2 and O2•- in mitochondria, indicating enhanced ROS production.
Potentially contributes to ROS accumulation due to altered complex I kinetics.
Potentially contributes to ROS accumulation due to altered complex I kinetics.

Biological replicates.Description: Images are representative of 4 paired different preparations of control and patient's fibroblasts.

Basic positive control.Description: Control human fibroblasts (NHDF) were used as a positive control for comparison.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test was applied, with a P < 0.05, to evaluate the statistical significance of differences.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence intensity of ROS probes comparable to control fibroblasts (NHDF).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in fluorescence intensity of ROS probes (H2O2 and O2•-) compared to control fibroblasts.

Material used.Description: Fibroblasts from a patient with PINK1 mutation were cultured at low density on fibronectin-coated dishes.

Readout description.Result Description: Marked reduction in cytochrome c content, approximately 50% reduction compared to control fibroblasts.
No direct effect on cytochrome c content described.
No direct effect on cytochrome c content described.

Biological replicates.Description: Images are representative of 5 paired different preparations of control and patient's fibroblasts.

Basic positive control.Description: Control human fibroblasts (NHDF) were used as a positive control for comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Direct treatment of permeabilized cells with the secondary antibody did not result in appreciable staining.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test was applied, with a P < 0.05, to evaluate the statistical significance of differences.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cytochrome c content and fluorescence intensity comparable to control fibroblasts (NHDF).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Approximately 50% reduction in cytochrome c content compared to control fibroblasts.
